abstract: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists reports a fourfold increase in precancerous growths on the genitals of women from 1973 to 2000; most of the growths are caused by the human papilloma virus, and some doctors believe that the increase in the number of growths is due to people having more sexual partners than in the past.
snippet: Precancerous growths caused by the human papilloma virus, a common sexually transmitted virus, are becoming more common in women, a medical group said.
lead_paragraph: Precancerous growths caused by the human papilloma virus, a common sexually transmitted virus, are becoming more common in women, a medical group said.

headline.main: Growths Linked to Venereal Virus Are on Rise in Women
headline.print_headline: Growths Linked to Venereal Virus Are on Rise in Women
headline.seo: Precancerous Genital Growths on Rise in Women, Report says
